engine.label: Oil Color & Level
engine.description: Check using the dipstick when engine is cold. Oil should be amber to light brown, not black or milky.

engine.label: Engine Sound (Cold Start)
engine.description: Listen for irregular noises on a cold engine start. There should be no knocking, ticking, or grinding sounds.

engine.label: Exhaust Smoke
engine.description: Check for blue smoke (oil burning), white smoke (coolant leak), or black smoke (rich fuel mixture).

engine.label: Coolant Level & Color
engine.description: Check coolant reservoir level and color. Should be between min/max marks and not rusty or oily.

body.label: Panel Gaps & Alignment
body.description: Check for consistent panel gaps and proper alignment. Inconsistent gaps may indicate previous repairs.

body.label: Paint Condition & Matching
body.description: Look for paint differences between panels, which may indicate repairs. Check for rust spots and bubbling.

body.label: Rust Inspection
body.description: Check common rust areas: wheel wells, door bottoms, trunk seals, and undercarriage.

body.label: Glass & Lights
body.description: Inspect all windows for cracks and chips. Check all lights for proper operation and moisture inside.

interior.label: Seat Condition
interior.description: Check for excessive wear, tears, stains, and proper adjustment mechanisms.

interior.label: Dashboard Warning Lights
interior.description: Start the car and check that all warning lights illuminate briefly and then turn off.

interior.label: Electronics & Features
interior.description: Test all electronics: windows, locks, mirrors, climate control, audio system, and navigation.

interior.label: Odor Check
interior.description: Smell for musty odors that might indicate water damage or mold issues.

chassis.label: Frame Inspection
chassis.description: Look for bent or damaged frame components, which may indicate a serious accident.

chassis.label: Undercarriage Damage
chassis.description: Check for scrapes, dents, or fluid leaks on the underside of the vehicle.

brakes.label: Brake Pad Thickness
brakes.description: Visually inspect brake pad thickness through the wheel spokes. Should have at least 3-4mm remaining.

brakes.label: Brake Rotor Condition
brakes.description: Check for scoring, grooves, or rust on the brake rotors. Surface should be relatively smooth.

brakes.label: Tire Tread Depth
brakes.description: Use a tread depth gauge or the penny test to check tire tread. Should be at least 3-4mm deep.

brakes.label: Tire Wear Pattern
brakes.description: Check for even wear across all tires. Uneven wear may indicate alignment or suspension issues.

suspension.label: Bounce Test
suspension.description: Push down on each corner of the car and release. It should bounce once and settle, not continue bouncing.

suspension.label: Shock/Strut Inspection
suspension.description: Look for leaking fluid on shocks/struts, which indicates they need replacement.

testDrive.label: Acceleration Test
testDrive.description: Test smooth acceleration without hesitation, vibration, or unusual noises.

testDrive.label: Braking Test
testDrive.description: Test brakes at various speeds. Car should stop in a straight line without pulling to either side.

testDrive.label: Steering Feel
testDrive.description: Check for play in the steering wheel and smooth turning without noises or vibration.

testDrive.label: Transmission Shifting
testDrive.description: Shifts should be smooth without hesitation, slipping, or hard engagement.
